dublinCore.dc:title: 113 S2123 IS: School District 318 Land Exchange Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Franken (for himself and Ms. Klobuchar) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

form.official-title: To authorize the exchange of certain Federal land and non-Federal land in the State of Minnesota.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the School District 318 Land Exchange Act.
The purposes of this Act are—

paragraph.text: to provide greater safety to the students of the Robert J. Elkington Middle School and the families of those students in Grand Rapids, Minnesota; and
to promote the mission of the United States Geological Survey.
The term District means Minnesota Independent School District number 318 in Grand Rapids, Minnesota.

subparagraph.text: The term Federal land means the parcel of approximately 1.3 acres of United States Geological Survey land identified as USGS Parcel 91-016-4111 on the map, which was transferred to the Department of the Interior by the General Services Administration by a letter dated July 22, 1965.
The term Federal land includes any structures on the land described in subparagraph (A).

paragraph.text: The term map means each of the maps entitled USGS and School Parcel Locations and dated January 15, 2014.

subparagraph.text: The term non-Federal land means the parcel of approximately 1.6 acres of District land identified as School Parcel 91-540-1210 on the map.
The term non-Federal land includes any structures on the land described in subparagraph (A).

paragraph.text: The term Secretary means the Secretary of the Interior.

section.header: Exchange of federal land and non-Federal land

subsection.text: If the District offers to convey to the United States all right, title, and interest of the District in and to the non-Federal land, the Secretary shall—

paragraph.text: convey to the District all right, title, and interest of the United States in and to the Federal land.
The value of the Federal land and non-Federal land to be exchanged under subsection (a) shall be determined—

subparagraph.text: by an independent appraiser selected by the Secretary; and
in accordance with the Uniform Appraisal Standards for Federal Land Acquisitions and the Uniform Standards of Professional Appraisal Practice.

paragraph.text: Appraisals conducted under paragraph (1) shall be submitted to the Secretary for approval.

subparagraph.text: If the value of the Federal land and non-Federal land to be exchanged under subsection (a) is not of equal value, the value shall be equalized through a cash equalization payment to the Secretary.
Amounts received under subparagraph (A) shall be deposited in the Treasury and credited to miscellaneous receipts.
